record.description: U. of C. Class of 1907 holds its 40th reunion. Attending the 40th reunion of the University of Chicago Class of 1907 yesterday were (left to right) Paul Gray, Whittier, California; John Moulds, Herbert, Michigan, secretary emeritus of the U. of C. board of trustees; Arthur G. Bovee, U. of C. professor of romance languages who is retiring; Harold H. Swift, president of U. of C. board of trustees; Miss Helen Norris, Chicago; Harold G. Moulton, economist with Brookings Institution, Washington; Miss Florence R. Scott, Los Angeles; Mrs. Arthur Baer, Chicago; Miss Anne S. Davis, director of girls' physical education, Chicago public schools; Martin Pierrot, Chicago, and Earl D. Hostetter, Chicago. Fourteen of the 1907 class are listed in Who's Who in America. The reunion was part of Alumni Week activities.
record.publisher: University of Chicago Library, Special Collections Research Center
